means: 强迫( impose的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: He vociferously opposed the state of emergency imposed by the government.
sentence.Network_cn: 他激烈反对政府强行宣布进入紧急状态。

sentence.Network_en: Sometimes a well-defined job becomes cluttered with self-imposed tasks.
sentence.Network_cn: 有时一项职责明确的工作会因一些自愿承担的任务而乱作一团。

sentence.Network_en: A wage freeze was imposed on all staff earlier this month.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个月早些时候，所有员工的工资都被冻结了。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 四级考试常见易混淆词语归纳--... ... 157.compromising 妥协的； 159.imposed 强加的； 160.moral 道德上的；.
心理学专业英语词汇(S2) ... selfimportance 妄自尊大 selfimposed 自己担负的 selfimposed penalty 自我惩罚.
Some experts think similar restrictions should now be imposed on compensation consultants , too ., 所以一些专家认为薪金顾问们也该被加以类似的限制.

America's capital injections to date have imposed less onerous terms , but its banks still need reasonable level of common equity to act as a credible first defence against losses .到目前为止，美国的注入资本要求很少的公司义务。但是美国的银行任然需要相当规模的普通股以作为保护银行免遭损失的第一道防线。

entry.def: If you impose something on people, you use your authority to force them to accept it.

example.ex: Britain imposed fines on airlines which bring in passengers without proper papers...
example.tran: 英国会对运载证件不齐全的乘客进入国内的航空公司课以罚款。

example.ex: Many companies have imposed a pay freeze...
example.tran: 许多公司已经强制冻结了工资。

entry.def: If you impose your opinions or beliefs on other people, you try and make people accept them as a rule or as a model to copy.

example.ex: Parents of either sex should beware of imposing their own tastes on their children.
example.tran: 父母双方都应切记不要把自己的喜好强加给孩子。

entry.tran: 使遭受，使承受(压力、痛苦等)
entry.def: If something imposes strain, pressure, or suffering on someone, it causes them to experience it.

example.ex: The filming imposed an additional strain on her.
example.tran: 拍摄任务使她承受了格外大的压力。

example.ex: ...the pressures imposed upon teachers by ceaseless curriculum reforms.
example.tran: 无休止的课程改革使教师承受的压力

entry.tran: 把…硬加给;把…强塞给;勉强(某人)做事
entry.def: If someone imposes on you, they unreasonably expect you to do something for them which you do not want to do.

example.ex: I was afraid you'd simply feel we were imposing on you...
example.tran: 我担心你会觉得我们是在勉强你。

example.ex: 'Mum thinks I should stop imposing on your hospitality, Leo,' said Grace.
example.tran: “利奥,我妈妈觉得我不应该再在这儿麻烦你了，”格雷丝说。

entry.def: If someone imposes themselves on you, they force you to accept their company although you may not want to.

example.ex: I didn't want to impose myself on my married friends.
example.tran: 我不想打扰自己已婚的朋友。

auth_sentence.content: I've imposed the curfew as a pre-emptive measure.
auth_sentence.res_content: I've imposed the curfew as a pre-emptive measure.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I've imposed the curfew as a pre-emptive measure.

auth_sentence.content: The ban was imposed after India conducted nuclear tests.
auth_sentence.res_content: The ban was imposed after India conducted nuclear tests.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The ban was imposed after India conducted nuclear tests.

auth_sentence.content: It is not being imposed from outside the country.
auth_sentence.res_content: It is not being imposed from outside the country.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It is not being imposed from outside the country.

Sentence.sentence: The very process imposed a limitation on the quantity of materials copied.
If no penalty is imposed on an employee for poor performance, other employees may react by reducing their productivity as well.
Such was the case in the early 1990s when Sears imposed a sales quota on its auto repair staff.
